channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: NW6 Winderemere Avenue, 18th July
item.description:
I asked rider to move it to a side… he said chill out, I will be back 10 mins… this is not acceptable … not the first time. It’s such a health and safety issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wasp nest on public right of way (18 Speldhurst Close), 18th July
item.description:
There is a wasps nest which seems to be located under a drain cover on Speldhurst Close. Photo attached. There are flys and wasps swarming around the drain cover and is positioned on the pedestrian route from Barnhill Avenue through to the houses on Speldhurst Close. Its been there for a number of weeks, and doesn't seem to be getting smaller or moving away at any point soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Speldhurst Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish dumped/flytipped, 18th July
item.description:
This spot seems to constantly be used to dump and fly tip rubbish. Is it possible for the Council to identify the culprit from information gathered fron the rubbish?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish bags dumped outside lisson Grove, 18th July
item.description:

item.title: Hackney Refuse team unable to access property, 18th July
item.description:
Sheperdhess Place is the access way to our clients property. For several weeks the refuse team have been unable to access the property and therefore unable to empty the bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): City Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Trees at Queens Mary's Roundabout, 18th July
item.description:
Trees at Queens Mary's / Roundabout/ Underpass When approaching the roundabout from Perry street if you are in the right hand lane and you want take the third exit your can not see vehicles coming round because the height of the trees they need cutting to a much lower level as it's dangerous you can not see what vehicles are coming round the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frognal Corner, London

item.title: Flytipping - every day, 18th July
item.description:
Just as a reminder that flytipping is a criminal offence. This is happening every day in Durfey Place, as documented on FixMyStreet. Can the Council please contact me to let me know how they intend to fix this issue?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durfey Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
